label: University of Nottingham Museum U.33.96

metadata.label: Title
metadata.value: Sherd of a mould decorated samian pottery bowl.

metadata.label: Rights
metadata.value: Images can be used for research for a non-commercial purpose or private study. Please contact Manuscripts and Special Collections if you require permission to publish or use an image for any other purpose.

metadata.label: Description
metadata.value: sherd of a mould decorated samian pottery bowl (Dragendorff form 30) preserved from the rim to the wall. The sherd shows an ovolo band above a decorated frieze, with no boundary seperating them. The frieze depicts, from left to right, the wings of a Victory facing left and Pudicitia, also facing left, set within an arcade supported by beaded rows. Just below the ovolo band, the capsized moulded maker's mark of Masclus I si shown, divided into groups of letters. Possibly found in London, Greater London. Produced at La Graufesenque, Southern France, during the Roman period (35-65 AD).

description.@value: Sherd of a mould decorated samian pottery bowl.
